title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 §§ 635-11.1 - Applicability and definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 §§ 635-11.1 - Applicability and definitions

State Regulations
(a) This Subpart
sets forth rules concerning: (1)
who can
enroll beneficiaries or individuals in: (i) a

Medicare Part D prescription drug plan or in a Medicare advantage plan with
prescription drug coverage; or
(ii)
a Fully Integrated Duals Advantage Plan for Individuals with Intellectual and

Developmental Disabilities (FIDA-IDD) which is authorized to enroll individuals
with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities pursuant to section
364-j
(27)(c)
of the Social Services Law; and
(2)
who can pursue
grievances, complaints, exceptions and appeals in such plans; (3)
these rules only apply to beneficiaries
who receive services which are operated, certified, authorized or funded by
OPWDD. (b) Definitions. As used in this Subpart: (1)

Act in the FIDA-IDD plan review
process
means doing any of the following within a FIDA-IDD plan: (i) filing a grievance; (ii)
submitting a complaint to the quality
improvement organization or to Federal or State government regulatory
agencies; (iii)
requesting and
obtaining a coverage determination (including, but not limited to, a request
for prior authorization, a formulary exception and a request for expedited
procedures); (iv)
filing and
requesting appeals and dealing with, or participating in, any part of the
appeals process; (2)

Act in the Part D review process
means doing any of the
following within the Part D Program: (i) filing a grievance; (ii)
submitting
a complaint to the quality improvement organization; (iii)
requesting and obtaining a coverage
determination (including, but not limited to, a request for prior
authorization, an exception to a tiered cost sharing structure, a formulary
exception and a request for expedited procedures); and
(iv)
filing and requesting appeals and
dealing with any part of the appeals process; (3)
DDRO
means an OPWDD
Developmental Disabilities Regional Office. (4)
DDSOO
means an OPWDD
Developmental Disabilities State Operations Office. (5)

Enroll
and
enrollment
means enrollment in, and disenrollment from: (i) a PDP; and/or
(ii)
a FIDA-IDD plan. (6)
FIDA-IDD
or
FIDA-IDD plan
means a Fully Integrated Duals Advantage Plan
for Individuals with Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities (FIDA-IDD)
authorized to enroll individuals with intellectual and/or developmental
disabilities under section
364-j
(27)(c)
of the Social Services Law. (7)

Party
means someone or
an entity or organization. (8)
PDP
means a prescription drug plan offered under the Medicare

Part D Program or a Medicare advantage plan that provides prescription drug
coverage offered under the Medicare Part D Program. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14

635-11.1
